name: World
description: Functions for getting and using world data, including blocks, entities, players, and environmental information. Accessible from scripts via the global `World` variable.

methods.name: isWorldLoaded
methods.description: `true` if a world is loaded, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: getLoadedPlayers
methods.description: A list of player entities currently within render distance.
examples:
const nearbyPlayers = World.getLoadedPlayers();
Chat.log(`There are ${nearbyPlayers.size()} players in render distance.`);

methods.name: getPlayers
methods.description: A list of all players currently on the tab list.

methods.name: getPlayerEntry
methods.description: The tab list entry for the given player, or `null` if they are not on the list.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the player.

methods.name: getBlock
methods.signature: World.getBlock(x: int, y: int, z: int) | World.getBlock(pos: BlockPosHelper | Pos3D)
methods.description: A helper for the block at the specified position, or `null` if the location is not loaded. This method supports two main overloads: by individual coordinates (x, y, z) or by a position object (pos).

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate of the block (part of the coordinate overload).

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate of the block (part of the coordinate overload).

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The Z coordinate of the block (part of the coordinate overload).

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: A position object for the block (part of the position object overload).

methods.name: getChunk
methods.description: A helper for the specified chunk, or `null` if it is not loaded.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate of the chunk (block coordinate >> 4).

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The Z coordinate of the chunk (block coordinate >> 4).

methods.name: getWorldScanner
methods.signature: World.getWorldScanner(blockFilter?: MethodWrapper(block: BlockHelper): boolean, stateFilter?: MethodWrapper(state: BlockStateHelper): boolean)
methods.description: Creates a `WorldScanner` or a `WorldScannerBuilder` to perform complex, filtered searches for blocks in the world. This is more efficient than manual iteration for large areas. If no arguments are provided, returns a builder to construct a complex scanner. If filters are provided, returns a ready-to-use scanner.

parameters.name: blockFilter
parameters.description: A function to filter by block type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: A function to filter by block state properties.

methods.name: findBlocksMatching
methods.signature: World.findBlocksMatching(id: string | string[], chunkrange: int, centerX?: int, centerZ?: int, blockFilter?: MethodWrapper(...), stateFilter?: MethodWrapper(...))
methods.description: Finds the positions of all blocks matching a given set of IDs or filters within a specified chunk range.

parameters.name: centerX
parameters.description: The center chunk coordinates for the search. Defaults to the player's current chunk.

parameters.name: centerZ
parameters.description: The center chunk coordinates for the search. Defaults to the player's current chunk.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single block ID to search for.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: An array of block IDs to search for.

parameters.name: blockFilter
parameters.description: Custom filter function.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Custom filter function.

parameters.name: chunkrange
parameters.description: The radius of chunks around the center to search.

methods.name: iterateSphere
methods.signature: World.iterateSphere(pos: BlockPosHelper, radius: int, callback: MethodWrapper(block: BlockDataHelper), ignoreAir?: boolean)
methods.description: Iterates over every block within a spherical radius and executes a callback function for each one.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: The center of the sphere.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius of the sphere in blocks.

parameters.name: ignoreAir
parameters.description: If `true`, the callback will not be called for air blocks. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function to call for each block found.

methods.name: iterateBox
methods.signature: World.iterateBox(pos1: BlockPosHelper, pos2: BlockPosHelper, callback: MethodWrapper(block: BlockDataHelper), ignoreAir?: boolean)
methods.description: Iterates over every block within a box defined by two corner positions.

parameters.name: pos1
parameters.description: The first corner of the box.

parameters.name: pos2
parameters.description: The second corner of the box.

parameters.name: ignoreAir
parameters.description: If `true`, the callback will not be called for air blocks. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The function to call for each block found.

methods.name: getScoreboards
methods.description: A helper for accessing scoreboard data.

methods.name: getEntities
methods.signature: World.getEntities() | World.getEntities(distance: double) | World.getEntities(types: string[]) | World.getEntities(filter: MethodWrapper(entity: EntityHelper): boolean)
methods.description: Gets a list of entities in the world, with optional filters for distance, type, or custom logic.

parameters.name: (none)
parameters.description: Get all entities in render distance (no parameters overload).

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Get entities within this distance from the player (distance overload).

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Get entities whose type ID is in this array (types array overload).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Get entities for which this function returns `true` (filter function overload).

methods.name: rayTraceBlock
methods.signature: World.rayTraceBlock(x1: double, y1: double, z1: double, x2: double, y2: double, z2: double, fluid: boolean)
methods.description: Performs a ray trace between two arbitrary points in the world.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: The starting X coordinate.

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: The starting Y coordinate.

parameters.name: z1
parameters.description: The starting Z coordinate.

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: The ending X coordinate.

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: The ending Y coordinate.

parameters.name: z2
parameters.description: The ending Z coordinate.

parameters.name: fluid
parameters.description: Whether to include fluids in the trace.

methods.name: rayTraceEntity
methods.signature: World.rayTraceEntity(x1: double, y1: double, z1: double, x2: double, y2: double, z2: double)
methods.description: Performs a ray trace between two points to find the first entity intersected.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: The starting X coordinate.

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: The starting Y coordinate.

parameters.name: z1
parameters.description: The starting Z coordinate.

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: The ending X coordinate.

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: The ending Y coordinate.

parameters.name: z2
parameters.description: The ending Z coordinate.

methods.name: getDimension
methods.description: The identifier of the current dimension.
examples:
const dimension = World.getDimension();
Chat.log(`Current dimension: ${dimension}`); // e.g., "minecraft:the_nether"

methods.name: getBiome
methods.description: The identifier of the player's current biome.
examples:
const biome = World.getBiome();
Chat.log(`Current biome: ${biome}`); // e.g., "minecraft:plains"

methods.name: getTime
methods.description: The total number of ticks processed since the world was created. Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.
examples:
const worldTime = World.getTime();
Chat.log(`Total world ticks: ${worldTime}`);

methods.name: getTimeOfDay
methods.description: The current time of day in ticks (0-23999). This value is affected by players sleeping. Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.

methods.name: isDay
methods.description: `true` if it is currently day.

methods.name: isNight
methods.description: `true` if it is currently night.

methods.name: isRaining
methods.description: `true` if the respective weather condition is active.

methods.name: isThundering
methods.description: `true` if the respective weather condition is active.

methods.name: getWorldIdentifier
methods.description: A unique identifier for the current world/server, typically based on the server IP or singleplayer world name.
examples:
const id = World.getWorldIdentifier();
Chat.log(`World ID: ${id}`); // e.g., "127_0_0_1_25565" for a local server

methods.name: getRespawnPos
methods.description: The player's current respawn position, or `null`.

methods.name: getDifficulty
methods.description: The current world difficulty as an integer. Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.
examples:
const difficulty = World.getDifficulty(); // 0: peaceful, 1: easy, 2: normal, 3: hard
Chat.log(`Difficulty level: ${difficulty}`);

methods.name: getMoonPhase
methods.description: The current moon phase as an integer (0-7). Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.
examples:
const phase = World.getMoonPhase(); // 0: full moon, 4: new moon
Chat.log(`Moon phase: ${phase}`);

methods.name: getSkyLight
methods.signature: World.getSkyLight(x: int, y: int, z: int)
methods.description: The light level (0-15) at the specified position. Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate to check.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate to check.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The Z coordinate to check.

methods.name: getBlockLight
methods.signature: World.getBlockLight(x: int, y: int, z: int)
methods.description: The light level (0-15) at the specified position. Returns `-1` if no world is loaded.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate to check.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate to check.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The Z coordinate to check.

methods.name: playSoundFile
methods.description: Plays a sound from an external audio file.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The path to the sound file (e.g., `.wav`), relative to the script's folder.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The volume to play the sound at (0.0 to 1.0).

methods.name: playSound
methods.signature: World.playSound(id: string, volume?: double, pitch?: double, x?: double, y?: double, z?: double)
methods.description: Plays a built-in Minecraft sound. Can be played at a specific world coordinate or globally (like a UI sound).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The sound event ID (e.g., "minecraft:entity.player.hurt").

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: The volume of the sound. (optional)

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: The pitch of the sound. (optional)

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The world X coordinate to play the sound at. If not provided, the sound is played globally (like a UI sound). (optional)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The world Y coordinate to play the sound at. If not provided, the sound is played globally (like a UI sound). (optional)

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The world Z coordinate to play the sound at. If not provided, the sound is played globally (like a UI sound). (optional)

methods.name: getBossBars
methods.description: A map of active boss bars, with the boss bar's UUID as the key.

methods.name: isChunkLoaded
methods.description: `true` if the chunk is loaded, `false` otherwise.

parameters.name: chunkX
parameters.description: The X coordinate of the chunk.

parameters.name: chunkZ
parameters.description: The Z coordinate of the chunk.

methods.name: getCurrentServerAddress
methods.description: The address of the current server, or `null` if in singleplayer.

methods.name: getBiomeAt
methods.signature: World.getBiomeAt(x: int, z: int) | World.getBiomeAt(x: int, y: int, z: int)
methods.description: Gets the biome at a specific location, provided the chunk is loaded. Supports overloads for X, Z coordinates or X, Y, Z coordinates.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X coordinate.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The Z coordinate.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate (for the X, Y, Z overload).

methods.name: getServerTPS
methods.description: A formatted string containing various TPS measurements.
examples:
const tpsInfo = World.getServerTPS();
Chat.log(tpsInfo);

methods.name: getTabListHeader
methods.description: A `TextHelper` for the header text, or `null` if it's not set.

methods.name: getTabListFooter
methods.description: A `TextHelper` for the footer text, or `null` if it's not set.

methods.name: spawnParticle
methods.signature: World.spawnParticle(id: string, x: double, y: double, z: double, count: int, deltaX?: double, deltaY?: double, deltaZ?: double, speed?: double, force?: boolean)
methods.description: Spawns particles in the world.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The particle ID.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The central X position to spawn the particles.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The central Y position to spawn the particles.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: The central Z position to spawn the particles.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of particles to spawn.

parameters.name: deltaX
parameters.description: The random X offset range for particle positions. (optional)

parameters.name: deltaY
parameters.description: The random Y offset range for particle positions. (optional)

parameters.name: deltaZ
parameters.description: The random Z offset range for particle positions. (optional)

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: The speed/velocity of the particles. (optional)

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If `true`, particles will be visible from further away. (optional)

methods.name: getRaw
methods.description: The raw Minecraft world object.
examples:
const rawWorld = World.getRaw();
// Advanced, low-level interaction with the raw ClientWorld object

methods.name: getServerInstantTPS
methods.description: The server's current instantaneous TPS.
examples:
const tps = World.getServerInstantTPS();
Chat.log(`Instant TPS: ${tps.toFixed(2)}`);

methods.name: getServer1MAverageTPS
methods.description: The server's average TPS over the last minute.
examples:
const tps = World.getServer1MAverageTPS();
Chat.log(`1-Min Avg TPS: ${tps.toFixed(2)}`);

methods.name: getServer5MAverageTPS
methods.description: The server's average TPS over the last 5 minutes.
examples:
const tps = World.getServer5MAverageTPS();
Chat.log(`5-Min Avg TPS: ${tps.toFixed(2)}`);

methods.name: getServer15MAverageTPS
methods.description: The server's average TPS over the last 15 minutes.
examples:
const tps = World.getServer15MAverageTPS();
Chat.log(`15-Min Avg TPS: ${tps.toFixed(2)}`);
